fields.label: Rent Fetch API key
fields.name: rent_fetch_api_key
fields.instructions: In a future release, a license key will be required for all syncing functionality. Manual entry functionality and plugin updates will continue to work normally without an API key.

fields.label: Site type
fields.name: apartment_site_type
fields.instructions: Controls whether this site uses Neighborhoods and Properties.

choices.single: This site is for a single property
choices.multiple: This site is for multiple properties

fields.label: Data sync
fields.name: data_sync
fields.instructions: How should we sync data from an API to this site?

choices.nosync: Do not automatically sync any API data into this site
choices.updatesync: Update data on this site with data from the API. Try not to delete posts added manually or data in manually-added custom fields which can supplement the API.
choices.delete: Delete all data that's been pulled from a third-party API.

fields.label: Sync term
fields.name: sync_term
fields.instructions: How often should the site automatically pull data from an API?

fields.label: Yardi/RentCafe
fields.name: yardi_integration_creds
fields.instructions: The Yardi API does not currently allow for autodetecting property IDs. You must manually enter property ID numbers to enable syncing.

sub_fields.label: Yardi Property Codes
sub_fields.name: yardi_property_code
sub_fields.instructions: Multiple property codes should be entered separated by commas

sub_fields.label: Enable Yardi API lead generation
sub_fields.name: enable_yardi_api_lead_generation
sub_fields.instructions: Adds a lightbox form on the single properties template which can send leads directly to the Yardi API.

sub_fields.label: Entrata Property ID
sub_fields.name: entrata_property_ids
sub_fields.instructions: If there are multiple properties to be pulled in, enter those separated by commas

sub_fields.label: RealPage PMC ID
sub_fields.name: realpage_pmc_id
sub_fields.instructions: The ID number for the organization as a whole.

sub_fields.label: RealPage Site IDs
sub_fields.name: realpage_site_ids
sub_fields.instructions: If there are multiple properties to be pulled in, enter those separated by commas

sub_fields.label: AppFolio Property IDs
sub_fields.name: appfolio_property_ids
sub_fields.instructions: For AppFolio, this is an optional field. If left blank, Rent Fetch will simply fetch all of the properties in the account, which may or not be your preference. Please note that if property IDs are present here, all *other* synced properties through AppFolio will be deleted when the site next syncs.

fields.label: Enable logging
fields.name: enable_rentfetch_logging
fields.instructions: If enabled, this setting will start logging processes into /wp-content/rentfetch-debug.log and /wp-content/rentfetch-debug-verbose.log. When disabled, this setting will automatically delete these files, as those can become large over time.

fields.label: Google reCaptcha
fields.name: google_recaptcha
fields.instructions: Required for Rent Fetch forms to use the reCaptcha integration.

fields.label: Google Maps API key
fields.name: google_maps_api_key
fields.instructions: Required for the map to function. This API key needs access to the Maps Javascript API, and can be restricted by referrer to only allow your website to use it.

fields.label: Google Geocoding API key
fields.name: google_geocoding_api_key
fields.instructions: Required for geocoding to function. This API key needs access to the Geocoding API, and CANNOT be restricted by referrer. We'd recommend either only adding this when you're actually needing it (most sites don't), or restricting it by IP address instead.

fields.label: Map marker
fields.name: google_map_marker
fields.instructions: An optional custom marker. Important: this needs to be uploaded at actual size to work properly (even if it's an SVG file). Google's default marker is 43px tall and 27px wide, for reference.

fields.label: Map styles
fields.name: google_maps_styles
fields.instructions: Paste in a json array from SnazzyMaps.com or from Google's map styler.

fields.label: Maximum number of properties to show
fields.name: maximum_number_of_properties_to_show
fields.instructions: -1 allows for ALL available properties to show

fields.label: Property availability display
fields.name: property_availability_display
fields.instructions: Even if this is set to ignore availability, properties still must have associated floorplans in order to display (since a significant portion of what we show in property archives comes from a property's associated floorplans).

fields.label: Starter search components
fields.name: starter_search_components
fields.instructions: This is the starter search, which can be output with the [propertysearch] shortcode (usually placed on the homepage of a site).

sub_fields.label: Enable text-based search
sub_fields.name: text_based_search
sub_fields.instructions: Please note that this functionality works best with Relevanssi enhancing your site's search capabilities.

sub_fields.label: Enable property type search
sub_fields.name: type_search
sub_fields.instructions: Property type is an arbitrary category system that can be assigned to properties (e.g. student housing vs. residential housing). If you've not assigned any categories, this should be left off.

fields.label: Map search components
fields.name: map_search_components
fields.instructions: This is the map-based search, which can be output with the [propertymap] shortcode (by default, this should be placed at /apartment-search).

sub_fields.label: Enable text-based search
sub_fields.name: text_based_search
sub_fields.instructions: Please note that this functionality works best with Relevanssi enhancing your site's search capabilities.

sub_fields.label: Enable neighborhoods search
sub_fields.name: neighborhoods_search
sub_fields.instructions: This functionality requires metabox.io and the MB Relationships addon, and without both these installed, this will not function properly. It also requires that you've created some neighborhoods and linked properties with those neighborhoods. If you've not done these things, you should disable this field.

sub_fields.label: Enable property type search
sub_fields.name: type_search
sub_fields.instructions: Property type is an arbitrary category system that can be assigned to properties (e.g. student housing vs. residential housing). If you've not assigned any categories, this should be left off.

sub_fields.label: Enable date-based search
sub_fields.name: date_search
sub_fields.instructions: The date-based search requires that you have availability dates. If you're managing properties and floorplans manually (not through an API), it's strongly recommended to disable this field.

sub_fields.label: Enable price-based search
sub_fields.name: price_search
sub_fields.instructions: The price-based search requires that you have pricing set for individual floorplans to work properly.

fields.label: Maximum bedrooms to search
fields.name: maximum_bedrooms_to_search
fields.instructions: If you were to enter "9" then the bedrooms dropdown would show "9+ Bedrooms" and would hide all numbers above 9.

fields.label: Price filter
fields.name: price_filter
fields.instructions: Settings for the price filter

fields.label: Number of amenities to show
fields.name: number_of_amenities_to_show
fields.instructions: If this site uses amenities, how many should be shown in the search filter? (Shown in order of popularity.)

fields.label: Property footer grid
fields.name: property_footer_grid
fields.instructions: By default, this shows on the individual neighborhood and properties templates when multiple properties are connected to a neighborhood. If there are less than two properties that would show, this area simply does not appear.

sub_fields.label: Maximum properties to show
sub_fields.name: number_properties
sub_fields.instructions: The maximum number of properties to show. By default, this will show all (-1) properties

fields.label: Property pricing display
fields.name: property_pricing_display
fields.instructions: Show either the pricing range, e.g. "$1999 to $2999", or  just the minimum "From $1999"

choices.menu_order: Menu order (use this if utilizing drag/drop reordering)
choices.title: Alphabetical, based on property name
choices.name: Alphabetical, based on property slug

fields.label: Single property components
fields.name: single_property_components
fields.instructions:
These settings control which default components of the page display. Please note that theme developers can also customize this display in several other ways. Each individual section can be replaced by removing the corresponding action (see actions here), or you can simply add a single-properties.php file to the root of your theme.

Please note that each individual section will only display if there's enough information to meaningfully display it. A property with no images set will not output a blank "images" section, for example.

sub_fields.label: Enable lease details display
sub_fields.name: enable_lease_details_display
sub_fields.instructions: This is the optional generic custom content area of the page (it will only display if there's some content to show)

sub_fields.label: Enable property map
sub_fields.name: enable_property_map
sub_fields.instructions: Requires that you've set up a Google API key in the Google Integrations settings

fields.label: Contact button
fields.name: contact_button
fields.instructions: A button linking either to a static page on the site, to a gravity forms lightbox, or to a single third-party locations. This will be the same link for every floorplan (it is not dynamic).

fields.label: Availability button
fields.name: availability_button
fields.instructions: A button which can pull in the availability link for each individual floorplan, with a single fallback link to use if no availability url is available.

sub_fields.label: Button behavior
sub_fields.name: button_behavior
sub_fields.instructions: How should this button behave when this floorplan does not currently have units available?

choices.fallback: Fall back to a static link

fields.label: Tour button
fields.name: tour_button
fields.instructions: A button to show a lightbox with a video, or an external link (this link is always per-floorplan).

fields.label: Link to floorplan single template
fields.name: single_button
fields.instructions: A button which simply links to the individual floorplan template.

fields.label: Floorplan pricing display
fields.name: floorplan_pricing_display
fields.instructions: Show either the pricing range, e.g. "$1999 to $2999", or  just the minimum "From $1999"
